body:
I see the timer being cancelled here:

https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/main/extensions/websockets-next/runtime/src/main/java/io/quarkus/websockets/next/runtime/Endpoints.java#L248-L250

I'm not sure if the timing is right and if the timer should be cancelled before completing the close.
Could you check if this code is called?

I think it would probably help if you could prepare a reproducer (but I'm not sure it's easily doable).

Also I'm wondering if, when the issue is solved, we should demote these messages to debug.

@mkouba that's probably one for you.

> It seems that the timer sometimes is not canceled on connection close. It's even possible that it's even worse and no close callbacks are called or there's some connection leak.
> I have logs on each type of callbacks, and I only see `@OnOpen` and then `WebSocket is closed` is right after that. No `@OnError` or `@OnClose`

Hm, an `@OnClose` callback should be definitely invoked when a connection is closed. Have you tried to enable the [traffic logging](https://quarkus.io/guides/websockets-next-reference#traffic-logging) to see if a connection is closed properly?

But if it isn't closed properly, then what?
How do I make sure it is closed properly? (although everything could happen, it's network).

Also, it seems that any of the methods before `vertx.cancelTimer(timerId);` could throw/fail, making it run forever.

> But if it isn't closed properly, then what? How do I make sure it is closed properly? (although everything could happen, it's network).
> 
> Also, it seems that any of the methods before `vertx.cancelTimer(timerId);` could throw/fail, making it run forever.

I think that we need to find out more... and ideally be able to reproduce the problem with a simple app.
Unfortunately, I have no idea how to reproduce it. It just randomly happens on prod. And not always, but when it does, it just spams forever.

issue.title: WebSockets Next: fix the server autoPing timer
issue.body:
- only send the ping if connection is open
- make sure we always try to cancel the timer
- fixes #47235

issue.title: Test coverage for Websocket next server autoping timer #47271
issue.body:
### Summary

Test coverage for the fix implemented in PR #47235, improves robustness regarding an issue with WebSockets auto-ping timers.
Upstream fix --> https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/47271 
Original issue --> https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/47235

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] Dependency update
- [ ] Refactoring
- [ ] Backport
- [x] New scenario (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] This change requires a documentation update
- [ ] This change requires execution against OCP (use `run tests` phrase in comment)
- [ ] This change requires execution with OCP on Aarch64 (use `run arm tests` phrase in comment)

### Checklist:
- [x] Methods and classes used in PR scenarios are meaningful
- [x] Commits are well encapsulated and follow [the best practices](https://cbea.ms/git-commit/)
